summary:
I am a UEFA A and NZF/OFC A Licence coach with a Masters Degree in Performance Coaching from the University of Stirling and a Bachelors Degree in Sports and Exercise Sciences from Coventry University. 

Working across 8 different countries in 3 continents, I have a vast understanding of how football looks across different regions and how cultural differences affect the beautiful game.

I am always interested to hear from anyone, regarding all things football and coaching, so feel free to message me on LinkedIn.

awards.title: BUCS Team of the Year (Shortlisted)
awards.description: Awarded to the best performing BUCS team within CUSU.

awards.title: Best Club Leader (Shortlisted)
awards.description: Awarded to an individual who has lead, organised and contributed to their sports club. To help improve the work of the club both on and off the field of play.

awards.title: Coach of the Year (Shortlisted)
awards.description: Awarded to the coach who has gone above and beyond to ensure success for their team and students, both in sporting endeavours and academically.

awards.title: Ian Dunn Service to Sport Award (Awarded)
awards.description:
The Ian Dunn Service to Sport Award recognises a student's 'Outstanding contribution to sport' within Coventry University.
From a very strong field I won the award for my commitment to improving Coventry University's football programme, winning the league with the 3rd team, organising our first ever CUFC international tour to the Turks and Caicos Islands, helping develop a new inter-university league for non-BUCS teams and developing football on campus by offering opportunities to students of all abilities to participate.
I am massively honoured to have won this award and it caps off a fantastic year for myself and CUFC.

profile_positions.title: First Team Coach

profile_positions.description:
From the first contact to the TCIFA to the flight home I organised one of the most ambitious projects Coventry University has ever ventured on, with 18 members of CUFC travelling to the Turks and Caicos Islands from the 31st May-22nd July to help develop, coach and play football.

My role was to organise the trip through my personal contacts within the TCIFA, and included gaining sponsorship, organising flights, selecting the correct people for the trip, whilst also encouraging participating to do their coaching badges whilst providing ongoing CDP for themselves.

On this trip I coached the University touring team to an undefeated tour, beating the Turks and Caicos Islands Men's National Team and 4 other teams along the way, including one who fielded a MLS drafted player. We also won a beach soccer tournament.

Alongside this I coached at all levels of the TCIFA Academy setup, with my main responsibility being coaching the Under 17's Boys National Team. I also coached the Women's National Team, the Under 15 Boys, Under 12 Boys and Under 7's co education grassroots programme. This also included me coordinating the grassroots programme one day whilst the TCIFA Technical Director was away.

Finally, I organised the donation of hundreds of pairs of football boots, shin pads, goalkeeper gloves, goals and full kits to players on the islands.

A massively rewarding trip and one I would not hesitate to organise again!
profile_positions.title: Project Manager/Head Coach
